title: Top 10 Essential Garden Crops: Grow These to Feed Your Family!

tasks.task: Growing an organic garden with 10 essential crops.
subtasks: Planting and caring for herbs (chives, mint, sage, thyme, rosemary).
Growing salad greens like lettuce in containers or raised beds.
Cultivating root vegetables such as carrots, beets, and parsnips.
Growing high-value crops like Brussels sprouts and sweet corn.
Raising blueberries and strawberries in containers or raised beds.
Planting squash (zucchini, butternut, spaghetti) and cucumbers.
Growing broccoli for winter harvests.
Cultivating tomatoes and peppers for fresh and preserved consumption.
Planting and harvesting potatoes and sweet potatoes.
Growing beans (pole and bush varieties) for fresh or preserved use.
Raising garlic in raised beds or containers for year-long storage.
Harvesting and preserving herbs (drying, freezing, making tea).
Collecting and freezing squash and cucumbers for use in winter.
Freezing, canning, or dehydrating tomatoes, peppers, and other vegetables.
Curing potatoes and sweet potatoes for long-term storage.
Processing garlic for storage and replanting.

tasks.task: Managing a garden through a complete growing season.
subtasks: Planting and nurturing crops through spring and summer.
Adjusting planting times for fall and winter harvests.
Implementing season extension techniques (hoop houses, shade cloth).
Managing pests and diseases in the garden.
Rotating crops and maintaining soil health.

tasks.task: Adapting garden practices for different climates.
subtasks: Choosing heat-resistant varieties for hot climates.
Using shade cloth in areas with long summers.
Adjusting planting times for a shorter growing season (e.g., Michigan).
Selecting appropriate crops based on climate and microclimate.
Growing herbs in grow bags or portable containers.
Using containers for blueberries, strawberries, and other crops.
Planting beans vertically in containers or raised beds.
Utilizing raised beds for root vegetables, garlic, and other crops.
